instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: 3476 freezing
threads.message: Have a 3476 that chimes on startup, has fan etc. checked all components and traces around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, but it either crashes on start up(sometimes), or freezes(mostly) with the apple logo and an empty progress bar. If I change the SSD, it boots but very slowly and then goes right to recovery. If I plug in my external drive via USB it freezes too (known working external drive). Ideas where to go from here?

threads.title: 3476 freezing
threads.message: Start with inspecting the board under microscope and run ASD 162 EFI and report result.....

threads.title: 3476 freezing
threads.message: Pretty sure this one will be hopeless unless there is signs of liquid or <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> was messed with.
